entry.title: OpenText training and certification for SAP resellers
entry.content:
Boost Your Services. Build Customer Trust. Get Certified.

Over half of SAP license and cloud sales involve a trusted partner. With sales growth of more than 27% projected in the coming year, there‚Äôs never been a better time to strengthen your offering for 2025/2026.

SAP and OpenText are excited to launch the updated training and certification program for SAP SuccessFactors Document Management Core by OpenText (also known as OpenText Core Content Management for SAP SuccessFactors ).

Why this matters for you and your customers
If your customers use SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central but lack a fully integrated HR document management solution, you have a perfect opportunity to deliver sustainable, transformational change. With the SaaS solution SAP SuccessFactors Document Management Core, you can help your customers:

  • Streamline onboarding and HR processes with automation and workflows.

Provide secure, role-based access to employee files from within SAP SuccessFactors HCM

  • Meet data privacy requirements while ensuring complete employee files with records management
  • Improve HR communications with accurate and personalized employee documents

As SAP‚Äôs largest Solution Extension partner, OpenText offers a product that is SAP-tested, validated, and approved‚Äîgiving your customers confidence in your services. Trained partners can deliver an integrated HR document management platform within weeks, providing your customers with a more compliant solution across the entire hire-to-retire cycle.

Why certification is essential
SAP will only provide full support for configurations implemented by certified partners. Without the badge, you risk delays and limitations in being able to provide the support your customers expect.

When you complete the course and pass the exam, you‚Äôll be equipped to deliver exceptional customer experiences when implementing SAP SuccessFactors Document Management Core. Certification will showcase to customers you‚Äôre ready.

You can also grow your revenue with expanded services such as advanced document workflows, intelligent capture, AI and API integrations. Explore Standard or Premium individual learning subscriptions.

Get certified today

 Partner certification exam.

  • This is a scheduled 2-hour exam
  • Number for questions:  60
  • Questions format: The test includes question formats such as multiple choice and true/false.
  • Passing Score:  70%
  • Language: English
  • Investment: $500 USD (or your country's currency equivalent, excluding VAT or other taxes)
  • See also Additional Details, including certification validity & renewal and retakes policy information.

Prepare for the certification exam with solution training

If you want to enhance your customer service abilities and get closer to a 100% pass rate, we highly recommend that you enrol in a small group training program.

What you can expect

  • Two days of instructor-led training for SAP resellers (OpenText reseller status is not necessary). 
  • Available in English and German.
  • Investment: $2,400.00 USD (or local currency equivalent, excluding VAT and taxes).

What you‚Äôll gain from the training

  • Live, interactive sessions led by expert trainers
  • Guidance on configuration, integration, and personalization.
  • Tools to deliver targeted, automated communications.
  • Preparation for the certification exam.
  • Promotion of your services through SAP and OpenText reseller channels.

Discover additional learning subscription options to continue your growth journey.

Ready to take the next step?
Register now for the upcoming virtual training session for SAP SuccessFactors Document Management Core by OpenText. For more details, contact training@opentext.com.

Let‚Äôs work together to make every SAP SuccessFactors HCM project a success.

SAP SuccessFactors Document Management Core by Open Text , HCM Employee Self-Service , Partnership ,

entry.title: Certifications not visible on " my certifications " on learning.sap
entry.content:
My valid certifications are not visible under " my certifications" on learning.sap. I checked some similar existing queries and also raised a query with support. They have verified that my universal id is correctly set up and also the email attached to my profile is correct and they are able to see that I have certifications. 

But they also said that "my certifications" tab is experiencing some technical issue so it is not visible on my end. And then they closed the ticket. Can someone please let me know if they are also facing similar issues. It has been quite a few days I am not able to see the certifications and also I don't understand, if I cant access it how can I renew it?

Appreciate any feedback and response

Thanks

entry.title: How I Prepared for SAP C_AIG_2412 (AI Foundation) ‚Äì A Practical Approach That Actually Works ?
entry.content:
Hey everyone,

I recently completed my preparation for the SAP Certified Application Associate ‚Äì SAP AI Foundation (C_AIG_2412) exam, and I wanted to share my approach and what really helped me along the way. I saw many threads here about the best way to study or what topics to focus on, so here‚Äôs a concise, experience-based breakdown that might help others too.

üß© Problem: Where to Begin?

When I first started, the biggest challenge was understanding what‚Äôs actually expected in the C_AIG_2412 exam. The official SAP Learning Hub has great material, but I found it a bit scattered for someone trying to build a full picture of AI within SAP BTP and AI Launchpad.

‚úÖ My Solution:

Here‚Äôs how I structured my preparation in 3 phases:

1Ô∏è‚É£ Phase One ‚Äì Foundation (Understanding the Ecosystem):
I began with SAP‚Äôs official Learning Journey for AI Foundation. It helped me understand the integration of SAP AI Core, AI Launchpad, and AI lifecycle management. I noted down key features like model deployment, governance, and responsible AI use.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Phase Two ‚Äì Hands-On Practice:
Theory alone wasn‚Äôt enough. I used the SAP BTP Trial Account to deploy a small AI scenario using SAP AI Core. This gave me a strong grip on the workflow and terminology that appear in the exam.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Phase Three ‚Äì Practice Questions & Gap Fixing:
In this stage, I started practicing using C_AIG_2412 dumps and practice tests from MyCertsHub
. What I liked was that the practice material reflected real-world exam logic‚Äînot just memorization, but scenario-based questions on AI lifecycle, data pipelines, and AI Launchpad management.
I used these practice questions to identify weak areas and went back to the SAP documentation to fill the gaps.

üîç Key Exam Areas I Encountered:

Understanding SAP AI Core and SAP AI Launchpad

Managing AI models and pipelines within SAP BTP

Applying Responsible AI principles

AI Governance and Monitoring

Integration with SAP Data Intelligence

üß† Pro Tip:

Don‚Äôt skip hands-on practice. Even a small deployment scenario will make the architecture questions much easier to understand.
Also, go through MyCertsHub practice tests right before the exam‚Äîthey simulate timing pressure and question patterns very closely to what I faced.

üìò Final Thoughts:

The C_AIG_2412 certification isn‚Äôt just about memorizing content‚Äîit‚Äôs about understanding how SAP embeds AI into its ecosystem responsibly and efficiently. If you follow structured learning, do some real practice, and test yourself with authentic resources, you‚Äôll pass confidently.

Hope this helps others preparing for the exam!
Would love to hear how others are approaching the AI Foundation certification in 2025.

**Best regards,**
*Arsath Deen*

entry.title: Preparing for SAP C_CPE? Here‚Äôs How I‚Äôm Studying Each Section Without Feeling Overwhelmed
entry.content:
Whenever I start learning something new, I like to have everything in order.
Before I even open the first tutorial, I plan what I‚Äôll study first, what comes next, and how I‚Äôll track it.

Recently, I started preparing for the SAP C_CPE (SAP Certified Associate - Backend Developer - SAP Cloud Application Programming Model) certification. Since this exam covers a mix of BTP architecture, SAP BAS, CAP, Side by side extensions, Cloud Foundry & Kyma Runtime  it can easily feel like too much at once. So I created a simple structure to move step by step without feeling lost.

I began with the learning about BTP, and doing hands on by following SAP Learning Journeys, creating subaccount and adding entitlements and services (It gave me a very clear understanding of BTP architecture) and then Developing appliaction using high productivity tools of SAP BAS, Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) because it‚Äôs the foundation of most topics in this certification. I‚Äôm spending around two weeks learning about CDS models, service layers and how everything connects in a CAP project. I‚Äôm following the official SAP Learning Journey https://learning.sap.com/certifications/sap-certified-associate-backend-developer-sap-cloud-programming-model and doing small hands-on exercises along the way.

My next focus is Cloud Foundry. I‚Äôll spend about a week learning how to efficiently develop, run, and manage cloud-native applications on SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry Runtime.

After that, I‚Äôll move to Side by side extention on BTP.  This will cover deploying  extension and integrating the app into SAP Build Work Zone.

The next stage is Developing Appliactions in Kyma Environment. I‚Äôll take about two weeks to explore a comprehensive understanding of Kubernetes and to orchestrate the deployment of the applications in the cloud. 

Finally, I‚Äôll study Advanced Extensions with SAP Cloud SDK for about two more weeks. These are slightly advanced topics but very useful for understanding to develop and integrate Java, JavaScript, and TypeScript extension applications for SAP solutions like SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

So in short, this will be my roadmap-

Recommended Study Sequence

Here‚Äôs the order I suggest, from foundational to more advanced :

  1. Exploring SAP Business Technology Platform 5hrs (link : https://learning.sap.com/courses/exploring-sap-business-technology-platform)
    • This gives you a broad overview of the entire platform (services, architecture, what BTP is). Good for building your base understanding.
    • So start here.
  2. Develop Full‚ÄëStack Applications Using Productivity Tools in SAP Business Application Studio 8hrs (https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/develop-full-stack-applications-using-productivity-tools-in-sap-business-application-studio)
    • Once you know the platform, you learn the developer tooling (BAS = Business Application Studio) which is key for CAP and full-stack apps. 
    • So this is your next step.
  3. Develop Applications on SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry Runtime 4hrs(https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/developing-applications-on-sap-btp-cloud-foundry-runtime)
    • The Cloud Foundry runtime is a major runtime environment in BTP. Understanding how to build and deploy there is critical. 
  4. Build Side‚Äëby‚ÄëSide Extensions on SAP BTP 8hrs (https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/build-side-by-side-extensions-on-sap-btp)
    • After tooling and platform basics, you dive into extension scenarios (for example side-by-side extensions of S/4HANA using CAP). This aligns closely with CAP certification topics.
  5. Developing Applications in SAP BTP, Kyma Runtime 8hrs(https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/developing-applications-in-sap-btp-kyma-runtime)
    • Kyma Runtime is more advanced (Kubernetes, microservices, event-mesh) and often sits on top of foundational knowledge. 
  6. Develop Advanced Extensions with SAP Cloud SDK 11hrs (https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/develop-advanced-extensions-with-sap-cloud-sdk)
    • This is relatively specialized/advanced (SAP Cloud SDK, perhaps custom libraries, integrations). Once you‚Äôve mastered the fundamentals above, you go here.

By the end of this plan, I‚Äôll go through a short revision period with mock questions and quick notes from my learning.

This structured approach keeps my study plan clear and prevents me from feeling overwhelmed.
I study for two to four hours a day which feels realistic, and the small milestones make it easier to stay consistent.

If you‚Äôre also preparing for C_CPE, it really helps to make your own sequence instead of jumping randomly between topics. The Learning Journeys are excellent resources, but having a personal roadmap makes a big difference.

 

I‚Äôd love to hear how others are preparing for this certification too.
What topics are you finding most challenging so far and how are you managing the learning.

entry.title: Digital Certificate Not Received After Passing Exam
entry.content:
Hi there, 

I recently passed the certification exam C_THR81_2505 on Oct 24, 2025, but haven't received the digital certification badge yet. 

I have submitted a ticket regarding this issue (5000240799) and currently still waiting for a response. 

  • In My Learning -> My Certifications, there are no certifications listed, and the exam attempt number under subscriptions were not deducted either.
  • However, In the SAP Certification page, where exams are scheduled, I do see the exam attempt number deducted, the result of the exam saying "passed", and the status of the exam being "Approved by Auditor" 
  • I can confirm that I have the two emails set up correctly (with different domains (different after the @ mark)) for my account as well 

I have also been seeing other similar issues posted on the community recently:

  • Subject: Escalation Request ‚Äì Digital Badge and Certificate Not Received for Completed Course Dear 
  • Certificate / Digital Badge Not Received 

It would be greatly appreciated if this post can be seen by one of the moderators here and hopefully escalate the issue. üôè

Thank you in advance.
